sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"出版物，定期刊物"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: magazine, journal, periodical, publication, newspaper, review, press
means: magazine ： 指刊登各种文章、小说、诗歌、评议的杂志。
journal ： 本义为"日报"，现在可指定期发生的周刊、月刊、季刊等或指学术团体出版的刊物、杂志或学报。
periodical ： 通常指除日报以外的定期出版刊物。
newspaper ： 一般指每日出版的报纸。
review ： 多指登载评论性文章或讨论重大事件的文章的刊物。
press ： 系报刊总称，也指报界或报业。

sentence.Network_en: A Wall Street Journal editorial encapsulated the views of many conservatives.
sentence.Network_cn: 《华尔街日报》的一篇社论概述了很多保守派人士的观点。

sentence.Network_en: The publishers planned to produce the journal on a weekly basis.
sentence.Network_cn: 出版者计划将该期刊定为周刊。

sentence.Network_en: In the post-war years her writing regularly appeared in The New Journal.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的文章在战后那几年经常出现在《新日报》上。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (originally denoting a book containing the appointed times of daily prayers): from Old French jurnal, from late Latin diurnalis (see diurnal)

entry.tran: （尤指某专门学科的）杂志，刊物
entry.def: A journal is a magazine, especially one that deals with a specialized subject.

example.ex: All our results are published in scientific journals.
example.tran: 我们的研究结果全都发表在科学刊物上了。

entry.tran: 日报，周报，…报（常用于报纸名称中）
entry.def: A journal is a daily or weekly newspaper. The word journal is often used in the name of the paper.

example.ex: He was a newspaperman for The New York Times and some other journals.
example.tran: 他是个记者，为《纽约时报》和其他一些报刊撰稿。

entry.def: A journal is an account which you write of your daily activities.

example.tran: 萨拉在日记中倾诉心事。

example.ex: On the plane he wrote in his journal.

means.word_mean: 1. a daily written record of (usually personal) experiences and observations
2. a periodical dedicated to a particular subject;
3. a ledger in which transactions have been recorded as they occurred
4. a record book as a physical object
5. the part of the axle contained by a bearing

auth_sentence.content: The Journal calls them "false positive epidemics".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Journal calls them "false positive epidemics".

stems_affixes.value_cn: 定期刊物,杂志,日报;日志,日记
stems_affixes.word_buile: journ日期+al……的→n.定期刊物,杂志,日报;日志,日记
journal杂志,日报+ist人→n.记者,新闻工作者
journ日期+ey→n.旅行,旅程 v.旅行
ad加强,增加+journ日期→增加日期
journ日期+ey→n.旅行,旅程 v.旅行

sentences.en: He kept a journal during his visit to Japan.
sentences.cn: 他在访问日本期间坚持记日记。

jushi.english: This short story was published by two journals of repute.
jushi.chinese: 这篇短篇小说由两种著名的杂志刊出。

jushi.english: He kept a journal during his visit to Japan.
jushi.chinese: 他在访问日本期间记日记。

jushi.english: The explorer kept a journal of his adventures.
jushi.chinese: 这位探险家把他的冒险经历写成日记。
